text: Calcineurin acts in synergy with PMA to inactivate I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an inhibitor of NF-kappa B .

The <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) promoter consists of several independent T cell receptor ( TcR ) responsive elements .
The induction of promoters dependent on these elements is inhibitable by the immunosuppressants cyclosporin A ( CsA ) and tacrolimus ( FK-506 ) .

Calcineurin , a Ca2+ / calmodulin - dependent protein phosphatase , is the FK-506 - and CsA - sensitive enzyme required for TcR mediated activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: We report that a constitutively active form of calcineurin partially substitutes for the Ca2+ co - stimulus required to activate the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter elements IL-2A ( which binds the factors <extra_id_0> OAP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Oct-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and IL-2E ( which binds NF-AT ) , and completely substitutes for the Ca2+ co - stimulus required to stimulate an NF-kappa B - dependent element .

text: Calcineurin stimulates the NF-kappa B element by enhancing inactivation of I kappa B / <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an inhibitor of NF-kappa B , thereby increasing the amount of nuclear NF-kappa B DNA binding activity .

text: These data provide the first demonstration in vivo that activation of a protein phosphatase can inactivate I kappa B , and suggest one possible explanation for mechanism - based toxicities associated with FK-506 and CsA by demonstrating that these drugs can inhibit the calcineurin - dependent activation of a virtually ubiquitous transcription factor .
